title: Angel Blowing a Trumpet
medium: graphite and watercolor on light blue wove paper
provenance_text:
Hilaire-Germain-Edgar Degas [1834-1917]; the artist's estate, Paris, France, September 1917 until July 1919; Atelier Degas sale, Galerie Georges Petit, Paris, France, July 2-4 1919, no. 100c [1]; purchased by Durand-Ruel, Paris, France. Private collection, Paris, France, possibly Jean-Pierre Selz [2], [3]; Bianchini Gallery, New York, NY, by June 1, 1965 until December 7, 1965 [4]; purchased by Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1965.
 
Notes:
[1]. "Tableaux, pastels et dessins par Edgar Degas et provenant de son atelier." This was the 4th and last sale of the Atelier Degas. The work is illustrated and listed in the catalogue as "Ange donnant de la trompette (Étude d’après un tableau ancient de l’ecole inalienne.)
[2]. Correspondence from Paul Bianchini of Bianchini Gallery indicates that this private collector purchased the drawing at a sale at the Palais Galliera in Paris. 
[3]. A hand-written note in the curatorial file indicates that Bianchini purchased the drawing from Jean Pierre Selz. 
[4]. Bianchini loaned the work to "Master Drawings from Degas to Lichtenstein, "Fort Worth Art Center, June 1-28, 1965.
